summary: Play as a Cleric/Paladin that was "gifted" immortality by a god. The reason? To be a glorified babysitter for the god they...
body:
Play as a Cleric/Paladin that was “gifted” immortality by a god. The reason? To be a glorified babysitter for the god they “worship”. Bonus points if they end up meeting the followers of this god and correcting them on what all this god has done.

Cleric: *Comes across a shrine to the traveller* oh come on you guys didnt even get his face shape right. His cheeks are much chubbier than that.

reblog.comment:

tags: sitting in lecture talking about alcibiades and my prof writes dunamis in greek letters on the board and my brain blew up
thanks socrates for influencing my critical role meta
summary: Dunamis is way scarier than we think its is
title: Dunamis is way scarier than we think its is
body:
Or, Matthew Mercer you glorious bastard

The accepted idea that we’ve been throwing around for the past week is that the brand new and ninth school of magic Dunamis is time magic or rebirth magic. I think it’s way bigger than that.

Duamis is a greek word that means power or influence. Right away, we get that this is the school of power magic or influence magic (makes you think of spells like Suggestion).

I don’t think it’s a coincidence that Trent Ikithon is one of the only practitioners of this magic in the Empire and is also one of the highest ranking people in it. It’s also not a coincidence that Caleb, Astrid, and Eodwulf were being taught more than just magic in traditional terms; they were taught charm and dance and interrogation and torture and execution and charisma; they were being taught how to influence people and how to exert force over people for power. The ‘extra’ things Caleb and his teammates were being taught weren’t extra at all; they are in fact integral to being able to practice Dunamancy. The practitioners of power magic seek out power in every aspect of life, whether societal, physical, or magical.

Dunamis isn’t the school of Time Magic or Life Magic or Rebirth Magic; it’s the school of Power and Influence Magic and it encompasses all of the above: and that’s much scarier.

It’s also not a coincidence that Caleb, Astrid, and Eodwulf were being taught more than just magic in traditional terms; they were taught charm and dance and interrogation and torture and execution and charisma; they were being taught how to influence people and how to exert force over people for power. Duamis is a greek word that means power or influence. Right away, we get that this is the school of power magic or influence magic (makes you think of spells like Suggestion).

I don’t think it’s a coincidence that Trent Ikithon is one of the only practitioners of this magic in the Empire and is also one of the highest ranking people in it. It’s also not a coincidence that Caleb, Astrid, and Eodwulf were being taught more than just magic in traditional terms; they were taught charm and dance and interrogation and torture and execution and charisma; they were being taught how to influence people and how to exert force over people for power. summary: Nott likes Yezza. She knows Veth was killed by her clan. Nott knows about Luke and feels terrible and wants to polymorph herself...
body:
Nott likes Yezza. She knows Veth was killed by her clan. Nott knows about Luke and feels terrible and wants to polymorph herself to look like Veth to make things “better” for Luke.


She knows all about Veth through Yezza and wants that life. Does Yezza know of this? Were they in on this together? She sent presents so I’m sure he knew about it.


Is it Thursday yet so they can ask Nott questions? Is Nott’s water phobia related to how Veth died?


I WANNA KNOW
